sentences.english: The stability of the economy and society would surely be affected, leaving people haunted.
sentences.chinese: 輪番提價勢必影響經濟和社會穩定，搞得人心惶惶。

sentences.english: Now Reyes is in a panic.
Strong rescues for Ding Li, two people fearful pity.
sentences.chinese: 強爲丁力所救，兩人惶惶相惜。

sentences.english: He was so upset he sat straight up in bed.
sentences.chinese: 他如此惶惶不安，直挺挺地在牀上坐起來。

sentences.english: This plasticizer scare has everyone panicking and it's being found in so many things.
sentences.chinese: 塑化劑風暴真讓人人心惶惶，好多東西里都有。

sentences.english: Raising price again and again should affect economy and social stability, and make people nervous.
sentences.chinese: 輪番提價勢必影響經濟和社會穩定，搞得人心惶惶。

sentences.english: Fear spread quickly through the village.
sentences.chinese: 全村很快便人心惶惶了。
她惶惶不安地走下樓梯。

sentences.english: If you're like me, the past couple of years have been painful and scary.
sentences.chinese: 如果你像我一樣度過了惶惶不可終日的兩年。

sentences.english: The villagers right away start dismay and disturbance and make popular agitated.
sentences.chinese: 村民們當即就開始恐慌和騷動，弄得人心惶惶。

sentences.english: It is said that the company is going to downsize staff, everyone is feeling anxious.
sentences.chinese: 據說公司要裁員了，大家全都人心惶惶。

sentences.english: That’s the real reason to be afraid.
sentences.chinese: 這就是人心惶惶的真正的原因。

sentences.english: Road is now a high-Yi Zhang, who is not worried All day long?
sentences.chinese: 現在道高一丈一，誰在惶惶不可終日？

definition: to be unable to carry on even for a single day/to be in a desperate situation
to be on tenterhooks (idiom)/to be anxious and frightened
panic-stricken (idiom)/to be in a flustered state/also written 張惶失措|张惶失措[zhang1 huang2 shi1 cuo4]
lit. a bird startled by the mere twang of a bow (idiom)/fig. sb who frightens easily, due to past experiences
variant of 張皇|张皇[zhang1 huang2]
variant of 倉皇|仓皇[cang1 huang2]
to not know the reason/to not know what to do
anxious and perplexed/uneasy and confused/suspicious and fearful
lit. every tree or bush an enemy soldier (idiom); fig. to panic and treat everyone as an enemy/to feel beleaguered
